content: basic top down socks small 56 st count 7-8 foot circumference medium 64 st count 8-9 foot circumference large 72 st count 9-10 foot circumference materials needed us1 32 circular needle for magic loop or us1 9 circular & us1 dpns to work heel & toe 100 grams fingering weight yarn wool/nylon blend removable stitch marker these are my perfect socks that i have found through trial and error of making many different socks i hope these work for you as well ~lindsey @alwaysyarnfirst 2024 pg1 notes ● these socks are knit cuff down on magic loop you can also use 9 circulars if you do i suggest using dpns to work heel & toe leave your non heel sts on circular & continue back with them after completing heel ● i like a shorter leg so these instructions follow that however you should add as much length as you want between ribbing and starting the heel as you feel comfortable ● i prefer the shadow wrap heel which is a short row heel you may add any preferred heel you d like instead ● i do my ssk a little different because i prefer how it looks see stitches used ● figuring out how long to knit the foot length measure your foot from heel to toe subtract 3 ¼ from that total for me my foot is 10 -womens us size 9 shoe- subtracting 3 ¼ means i would go until i reached 6 ¾ and then start my toe i measure from the inside of my heel using a sock ruler or a regular ruler will work also glossary k knit tbl through the back loop k2tog knit 2 sts together 1 st decrease ssk slip 1 st knitwise slip 1 st purlwise knit these 2 sts together tbl 1 st decrease fn front needle bn back needle rs right side ws wrong side @alwaysyarnfirst 2024 pg2 tutorials for methods used german twisted cast on twisted german cast on shadow wrap heel if you need to completely learn it go here if you just need a refresher go here join to work in the round how to join in the round with circular needles kitchener stitch kitchener stitch tutorial cast on/leg cast on 56 64 72 sts using the german twisted cast on separate sts so that half the number of sts is on each needle join to work in the round see tutorials if needed beginning 2x2 ribbing of k2 p2 around you may now put your detachable stitch marker on a stitch to mark your beginning of round side - or just note every time you see your yarn tail on the right side you are starting a new round knit 15 total rounds of ribbing knit 10 rounds of knit st heel knit across the first half of your sts of the round now we will begin the shadow wrap heel see tutorial leg see notes to determine how long to knit knit all
